Audio Description: Contributions of books for soldiers are solicited in this World War II poster. All the words and graphics on the poster are blue on a white background. The main graphic element in the poster is the silhouette of a bald eagle clutching a bundle of five books in its talons. The spread wings, body and talons of the eagle are blue. The eagle’s head and tail feathers are white outlined in blue. At the top of the poster are the words: “Give more good books to our men in the Armed Services.” To the left and below the eagle’s tail feathers are the words: “Send all you can to your local library or collection center.” At the bottom of the poster are the words: “1943 Victory Book Campaign. Sponsored by the American Library Association, the American Red Cross, The USO. ”
Description: Poster, 30.1 x 48.25 cm, sponsored by the American Library Association
